          "parent_id": "383d92c9-cd60-4fdd-afff-464d048c12ed",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["Tag/Attribute | Value |\n––––––– | —–– |"],
              ["<img>", [["b"], ["c"]]],
              [" | Below are the image map-specific attributes to use with "],
              ["<img>", [["c"]]],
              [". Regular "],
              ["<img>", [["c"]]],
              [" attributes apply. |"],
              ["usemap", [["c"]]],
              [" | The "],
              ["name", [["c"]]],
              [
                " of the map with a hash symbol prepended to it. For example, for a map with "
              ],
              ["name=\"map\"", [["c"]]],
              [", the image should have "],
              ["usemap=\"#map\"", [["c"]]],
              [". | | |"],
              ["<map>", [["b"], ["c"]]],
              [" | |"],
              ["name", [["c"]]],
              [
                " | The name of the map to identify it. To be used with the image’s "
              ],
              ["usemap", [["c"]]],
              [" attribute. | | |"],
              ["<area>", [["b"], ["c"]]],
              [" | Below are "],
              ["<area>", [["c"]]],
              ["-specific attributes. When "],
              ["href", [["c"]]],
              [" is specified, making the "],
              ["<area>", [["c"]]],
              [" a link, "],
              ["<area>", [["c"]]],
              [" also supports all of the attributes of the anchor tag ("],
              ["<a>", [["c"]]],
              [") except "],
              ["ping", [["c"]]],
              [". See them at the "],
              [
                "MDN docs",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [". |"],
              ["alt", [["c"]]],
              [
                " | The alternate text to display if images are not supported. This is only necessary if "
              ],
              ["href", [["c"]]],
              [" is also set on the "],
              ["<area>", [["c"]]],
              [". |"],
              ["coords", [["c"]]],
              [" | The coordinates outlining the selectable area. When "],
              ["shape=\"polygon\"", [["c"]]],
              [
                ", this should be set to a list of “x, y” pairs separated by commas (i.e., "
              ],
              [
                "shape=\"polygon\" coords=\"x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3, ...\"",
                [["c"]]
              ],
              ["). When "],
              ["shape=\"rectangle\"", [["c"]]],
              [", this should be set to "],
              ["left, top, right, bottom", [["c"]]],
              [". When "],
              ["shape=\"circle\"", [["c"]]],
              [", this should be set to "],
              ["centerX, centerY, radius", [["c"]]],
              [". |"],
              ["href", [["c"]]],
              [
                " | The URL of the hyperlink, if specified. If it is omitted, then the "
              ],
              ["<area>", [["c"]]],
              [" will not represent a hyperlink. |"],
              ["shape", [["c"]]],
              [" | The shape of the "],
              ["<area>", [["c"]]],
              [". Can be set to "],
              ["default", [["c"]]],
              [" to select the entire image (no "],
              ["coords", [["c"]]],
              [" attribute necessary), "],
              ["circle", [["c"]]],
              [" or "],
              ["circ", [["c"]]],
              [" for a circle, "],
              ["rectangle", [["c"]]],
              [" or "],
              ["rect", [["c"]]],
              [" for a rectangle, and "],
              ["polygon", [["c"]]],
              [" or "],
              ["poly", [["c"]]],
              [" for a polygonal area specified by corner points. |"]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
